Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A Game object is an instance of NordicTraveller.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nikolaj Ignatieff Schwartzbach

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Instantiates a new Game object with a random seed.
      Game(int seed)
      Instantiates a new Game object with a given seed.

    • Method Detail

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts the progress of this Game.

      • addCountry

        public void addCountry(Country c)
        Adds a given Country to this Game instance.
        Parameters:
        c - The country to add.

      • addRoads

        public void addRoads(City a,
                     City b,
                     int i)
        Adds roads between 'a' and 'b' (if they exist) with a given length. Adds a road from a->b, as well as a road from b->a (it is a symmetrical operator).
        Parameters:
        a - The first City object.
        b - The second City object.
        i - The length of the road to construct.

      • addRoads

        public void addRoads(java.lang.String a,
                     java.lang.String b,
                     int len)
        Adds roads between 'a' and 'b' (if they exist) with a given length. Adds a road from a->b, as well as a road from b->a (it is a symmetrical operator).
        Parameters:
        a - A string representing the first city.
        b - A string representing the second city.
        len - The length of the road to construct.

      • clickCity

        public void clickCity(City c)
        This method is called whenever a City is clicked. Is used mainly by the GUI instance to invoke player commands. It is also used by the LogPlayer to simulate mouse clicks.
        Parameters:
        c - The city to click.

      • getCity

        public City getCity(java.lang.String search)
        Gets a specific City object, based on its name (findOne). Will traverse all countries, and if a city with the name 'search' is found, it is returned. If no such city exists, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        search - The name of the city to search for (case sensitive).
        Returns:
        A City object with the name 'search', or null.

      • getCountries

        public java.util.List<Country> getCountries()
        Get a list of all countries within this Game instance.
        Returns:
        A list of all countries.

      • getGUIPlayer

        public Player getGUIPlayer()
        Gets the GUI Player (the one controlled by the GUI).
        Returns:
        A reference to the GUI Player.

      • getLoss

        public int getLoss()
        Determines how badly a Player gets robbed. Returns a random integer in the interval [minRobbery, maxRobbery] using the current Settings object. Uses the global Random generator.
        Returns:
        An integer representing how many euroes the given player lost.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Gets a list of all players associated with this Game instance.
        Returns:
        A list of all players.

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition(City c)
        Get the GUI position of a given City.
        Parameters:
        c - The city.
        Returns:
        The GUI position (in pixels) of the city 'c'.

      • getRandom

        public java.util.Random getRandom()
        Get the global Random object.
        Returns:
        A reference to the current Random generator.

      • getRandomStartingPosition

        public Position getRandomStartingPosition()
        Returns a random position within this Game instance. First chooses a random country, and then a random city within that country.
        Returns:
        A randomly chosen Position.

      • getSettings

        public Settings getSettings()
        Get the Settings object.
        Returns:
        A reference to the current Settings object.

      • getStepsLeft

        public int getStepsLeft()
        Gets the number of steps remaining in this Game instance.
        Returns:
        An integer representing how many steps this Game object can take before reaching the end.

      • getTotalTimeLeft

        public int getTotalTimeLeft()
        Gets how much time this game had at its conception.
        Returns:
        An integer representing how many steps this Game had available when it was created.

      • ongoing

        public boolean ongoing()
        Determines whether or not this game is still ongoing.
        Returns:
        True if this game is ongoing, false otherwise.

      • putPosition

        public void putPosition(City c,
                        java.awt.Point p)
        Associates a given City object with a position on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        c - The city.
        p - The position (in pixels).

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean repeat,
                  boolean removeLog)
        Resets this given Game instance. This consists of the following actions: * Reset the Log. * Reset the Random object with some seed. * Possibly removes the LogPlayer. * Resets all countries. * Assigns randomly positions to all players.
        Parameters:
        repeat - Whether or not to repeat the current seed. If not, a new seed is randomly chosen.
        removeLog - Whether or not to remove the LogPlayer (if it exists).

      • setGUIPlayer

        public void setGUIPlayer(Player p)
        Associates the GUI player with some specific Player instance.
        Parameters:
        p - The Player object representing the GUI Player.

      • setTotalTimeLeft

        public void setTotalTimeLeft(int totalTimeLeft)
        Changes the total time left of this Game instance.
        Parameters:
        totalTimeLeft - The new total time left.

      • step

        public void step()
        Advances this Game instance one step. A step consists of moving all players once on the road they're currently travelling, as well as updating money. If this step was the last step (that is, getStepsLeft()==1 before invoking this method), the Log representing the game is saved to 'last.log'.
